intro: Heteropterys lindleyana, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Loranthaceae family. It typically grows on the branches of host trees, such as those in the Myrtaceae family, and derives some of its nutrients from the host through specialized roots. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are orange-red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly affect the health of its host tree if left unchecked.
